comments:
Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1.run an application in Debug mode (with breakpoints)
2.reach a breakpoint.

More information:
Some log messages which should be shown under the console log are not and an error dialog window "pops up".
The "details" message says just "Error", but the summary one is about IOConsoleHandler.

The .metadata/.log contains stack about Unhandled event loop exception :

The exact error String is: "IOConsoleUpdater (Time of error: ...)".
The bug occurs a new time but I have no more process under debug (even if I am still under the Debug Perspective).

After analyse I have found the process I have spoken about opens an InputStreamReader on the standard input (System.in).
Perhaps there is problem with concurrent input/output on the console ?

Keeping on my analyse, I have just discovered that some logs are longer than 11000 characters !
After having seriously reduced such log messages, the problem has not occured for a moment ...

I've got a similar error whilst having the fixed width console option enabled (was set to 200). Once I disabled this option, the problem was gone. My program makes a pretty long output to a standard out.

I can confirm Simeon finding (btw, thanks for the workaround!!!). Removing the tick from "Preferences > Run/Debug > Console > Fixed width console" did it for me. We run our application with JBoss and Tomcat and both output quite long lines.
*** Bug 200717 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 201075 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 208239 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

fixed in 3.3.2

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 208084 ***
